meanings.definition: Hit or strike with a sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: She tried to swat the fly buzzing around her head.
meanings.sent2: The cat swatted at the toy mouse playfully.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to swat the mosquito but missed comically.
meanings.sent4: The boxer swatted his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to swat the ruler on the desk to get the students' attention.

meanings.sent1: With a quick swat, he knocked the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent2: The swat on the back was a sign of camaraderie among teammates.
meanings.sent3: The playful swat on the shoulder turned into a friendly wrestling match.
meanings.sent4: The sudden swat on the head made him realize his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The swat of the hammer on the nail echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Sudan.
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for Sudanese swat to use during his trip.
meanings.sent2: The market displayed the exchange rate for the swat clearly.
meanings.sent3: She found a forgotten swat note in her pocket and smiled.
meanings.sent4: The swat coins jingled in his pocket as he walked.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper handed him a handful of swat for his purchase.
